DataElement.preferredDefinition: the quantity measured or computed that is the greatest length of two (or more) measurements, especially the greatest measurement made along a single plane (dimension) in a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the longest dimension of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A tumor where the greatest dimension is greater than or equal to 2.1 centimeters.

Concepts.longName: Tumor Greater than or Equal to 2.1 cm
Concepts.definition: A tumor where the greatest dimension is greater than or equal to 2.1 cm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
